revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=BandLuxe |model=R528 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/19/2012 |manuf_country= |manuf=Gemtek |manuf_model=WVRTR-124GN |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,analog phone gateway |fcc_id=UZI-R528 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN25Q128-104FIP |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5PS1G63EFR-S6C |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (USB only) |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags=4G,CDMA |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=LTE_ROUTER |default_ssid_regex=^LTE_ROUTER$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:26:FA |oui_eth=00:26:FA |default_ch= }} ''Embedded LTE WiFi VoIP Router, Home Gateway''
[http://www.bandrich.com/R500_over.html R500 overview on BandRich's site] This device uses a '''Ralink''' RT??52 SoC. "HW00741015 WVRTR-124GN_V01" and "ESX-X04-0701 RoHS" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The Mini PCIe (USB) slot is occupied by a mobile broadband modem using the '''Qualcomm''' MDM9600 ([[wikipedia:Qualcomm_Gobi|Gobi]]) chip. There is a label on the bottom of the board (in the FCC photos) with a MAC starting with 00:26:FA ('''BandRich'''). The FCC router manual's sample SSID is '''LTE_ROUTER''', which does seem to be used by (a very small number of) some BandRich (OUI 00:26:FA) devices. This is presumed to be the SSID (and OUI) for the device. The default IP may be 192.168.1.1, but the manual does not list the default credentials (''Please refer to the Quick Start Guide included in the package.'').
